reply.question: 1. Does the app declare the collection of data?
reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states the collection of data such as device information, app usage statistics, and more.
reply.reference: When you open Stoic App we automatically collect certain data about the App and how you engage with it, such as your device, the pages of the App that you open, time, type, frequency and duration of your activities in the App, your approximate location. URL: https://www.getstoic.com/privacy-policy

This Privacy Policy explains how data that you share with Stoic is processed and protected.
The terms “user” and “you” refer to a person that uses Stoic Application (“App” or “Stoic App”), visits Stoic website, interacts with Stoic social media (together as “Services”) or contact Stoic.
The terms “Stoic” and “we” refer to a company incorporated in the US which is responsible for processing personal data as described in this Privacy Policy:
Stoic App Inc.
2261 Market Street #4243
San Francisco, C...

third-party analytics providers to collect and process this data. We may use cookies and similar tracking technologies to help us understand how users engage with the App. This information is anonymized and aggregated, and is solely used for performance analysis, identifying trends, and improving functionality.
We do not use or share this data with third parties for marketing or advertising purposes, nor do we sell it.
You can manage your analytics preferences within the App settings.
We do not ...

application development, hosting, maintenance and backup. These Partners, when process your data, are data processors.
We share users’ data with analytical services that support us with data analyses.
Personal data related to subscriptions and payments are – as it was explained above – solely processed by relevant App Stores providers and do not lie within Stoic competence.
The updated list of the third-party service providers is available in the App and on our website.

We collect data you share when you contact us either directly or fill in form on our website. When you contact us via email we collect your email address and may collect your name or other contact details (ie. telephone number) if you provide us with them. The contact form requires giving your name and email address.
We have access to detail of your social network profile if you contact us via Facebook, Instagram, LinkedIn, Twitter, Discord, or Mastodon.

reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects data such as the Internet Protocol (“IP”) address, device name, operating system version, configuration of the App, time and date of use, and other statistics.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy outlines the specific types of data collected by the app, ranging from basic device information to usage statistics.
reply.reference: Internet Protocol (“IP”) address, device name, operating system version, configuration of the App, time and date of your use of the service, and other statistics. URL: https://www.getstoic.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that the app declares the purpose of data collection and use, ensuring transparency for users.
reply.reference: This Privacy Policy explains how data that you share with Stoic is processed and protected. ...Contract – the data we process are necessary to provide you with service which is delivering content and exercises that address your individual needs. reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data. Users have the right to object data processing, request erasure of personal data, and restrict data processing. They can also withdraw consent for data processing, delete their data automatically upon removing the Stoic App, and object to receiving information from Stoic via email.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly outlines various user rights that include the ability to opt out of data collection or delete data in different circumstances. Users can object to processing, request data deletion, restrict data processing, withdraw consent, delete data upon app removal, and object to receiving promotional information.
reply.reference: Users have the right to object processing your personal data by Stoic, request erasure of personal data, stop processing temporarily, and file complaints. Additionally, users can exercise rights under CCPA and GDPR. URL: https://www.getstoic.com/privacy-policy. Stoic provides users with the ability to obtain and transfer their data, delete data upon app removal, and object to receiving information via email. URL: https://www.getstoic.com/privacy-policy.

reply.question: 5. Does the app share data with third parties?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app shares data with third parties for various purposes such as app development, hosting, maintenance, backup, analytical services, and AI features.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly mentions that data is shared with third parties for different services and features provided by the app.
reply.reference: We work with third-party service providers to provide website and application development, hosting, maintenance, and backup. These Partners, when processing your data, are data processors. We share users’ data with analytical services that support us with data analyses. When using AI features in the App, your content may be processed by third-party AI services. URL: https://www.getstoic.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with Apple HealthKit, Google Fit, and reputable AI service providers.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy states that the app shares health-related information with Apple HealthKit and Google Fit, as well as collaborates with reputable AI service providers for AI Features.
reply.reference: When using Stoic App, you may agree that we will share some health-related information with third party devices and services, such as Apple HealthKit and Google Fit. We do not share your information without your permission. For AI Features, we collaborate with reputable AI service providers. You are informed in the App about the specific AI service providers involved. URL: https://www.getstoic.com/privacy-policy
